metadata.name: Origami Butterfly A
metadata.description:
In 1817 Sir David Brewster described (in British patent no. 4136), a most marvelous instrument, the Kaleidoscope.

In these generative art works a space is repeatedly rotated, shifted, enlarged and folded.

The folds are like a reflection in a mirror, or an origami fold.

Points in the original space are colored according to their trajectory under these transformations.

The coloring scheme was inspired by a Scientific American article about how butterfly wings are colored according to location relative to focal points.

This image is 10000 by 10000 pixels in JPEG format.
